definition: Buddhist monk (loanword from Sanskrit "bhiksu")
Belgium/Belgian/abbr. for 比利時|比利时[Bi3 li4 shi2]
to compare/(followed by a noun and adjective) more {adj.} than {noun}/ratio/to gesture/(Taiwan pr. [bi4] in some compounds derived from Classical Chinese)
euphemistic variant of 屄[bi1]
surname Qiu
variant of 丘[qiu1]/hillock
mound/hillock/grave/classifier for fields
Machu Picchu
Buddhist nun (loanword from Sanskrit "bhiksuni")

sentences.english: Ordained Buddhist monk aged 18 – 35 of all nationalities.
sentences.chinese: 不限国籍，年龄为18至35岁的佛教比丘。

sentences.english: Taken away by a human being means that a Bhikkhu lives, mingling improperly with laity.
sentences.chinese: 被人所取是指比丘不如法地跟俗人混在一起。

sentences.english: Machu Picchu was built in the classical Inca style, with polished dry-stone walls.
sentences.chinese: 马丘比丘的建筑具有印加传统风格，抛光干石墙。

sentences.english: In a three-month retreat, monks and nun used to have a formal meal every day.
sentences.chinese: 在三个月的安居期间，比丘和比丘尼习惯于日中一餐。

sentences.english: In a three-month retreat, monks and nun used to have a formal meal every day.
sentences.chinese: 在三个月的安居期间，比丘和比丘尼习惯于日中一餐。

sentences.english: So he approached the Lord Buddha and requested ordination as a Bhikkhu.
sentences.chinese: 于是他靠近佛陀，请求受戒成为比丘。

sentences.english: Please ordain me a Bhikkhu so that I can develop the Noble Eightfold Path.
sentences.chinese: 请给我授戒让我成为比丘，这样我就能够修行八正道。

sentences.english: The next day the Espinar water strike spreads to communities near Machu Picchu.
sentences.chinese: 第二天，埃斯皮纳水罢工扩大到马丘比丘附近的社区。

sentences.english: However, Bhikkhus, this is just a simile.
sentences.chinese: 然而诸比丘，这只是一个比喻。

sentences.english: And how, bhikkhus, does a bhikkhu have clear comprehension?
sentences.chinese: 以及怎样，比丘，一个比丘有清楚的理解呢？

sentences.english: And how, bhikkhus, does a bhikkhu have clear comprehension?
sentences.chinese: 以及怎样，比丘，一个比丘有清楚的理解呢？

sentences.english: The ruins of Machu Picchu are one of the most beautiful and mysterious ancient sites in the world.
sentences.chinese: 马丘比丘废墟是世界上最美最神秘的古代遗址之一。

sentences.english: There was great lamentation amongst the Bhikkhus and the lay followers.
sentences.chinese: 在比丘之间和外行的追随者者之间弥漫着巨大的哀悼。

sentences.english: Fully endowed with the bhikkhus' training & livelihood.
sentences.chinese: 完整奉行比丘的训练与生活。

sentences.english: Take a 90 degree turn at the mountain ridge of Machu Picchu and to see the outline of a human face.
sentences.chinese: 把马丘比丘的山脊线左转90度，像人类脸孔的侧面。

sentences.english: One day, Buddha and his disciples went to the city to beg for food.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，佛陀与比丘们入城乞食时。

definition: arhat (Sanskrit)/a holy man who has left behind all earthly desires and concerns and attained nirvana (Buddhism)
World Honored One/Revered One of the World (Buddha)
Buddhist nun (loanword from Sanskrit "bhiksuni")
another name for Sakyamuni 釋迦牟尼佛|释迦牟尼佛, the historical Buddha
Prince Ananda, cousin of the Buddha and his closest disciple
Buddha (a person who has attained Buddhahood, or specifically Siddhartha Gautama)
Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)/Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism
(Buddhism) sangha/the monastic community/monk
Prince Ananda, cousin of the Buddha and his closest disciple
novice Buddhist monk
Brahmin
monk (Sanskrit: Sramana, originally refers to north India)/Buddhist monk
Nagarjuna (Nagarjuna Bodhisattva)
Sakyamuni Buddha (Sanskrit: sage of the Sakya)/Siddhartha Gautama (563-485 BC), the historical Buddha and founder of Buddhism
Buddhist teacher (Sanskrit transliteration)/also written 阿闍黎|阿阇黎[a1 she2 li2]
to extinguish worries and the sea of grief/nirvana (Buddhism)
